page.title: 14ARDIVOT FARM LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: The Grant family has owned Ardivot Farm for nearly 100 years. The farm is 148 hectares in size, and Mr Grant and two others work there. Mr Grant has 3 tractors, 1 combine harvester, 2 balers and a dung spreader. Two crops are grown on the farm, barley and grass, and there is a field which is leased to Moray Estates who grow potatoes. The grass is made into silage and hay for cattle feed. The good barley goes to the maltings, then to the distilleries, while the poorer quality barley goes to the cows. Mr Grant keeps 104 beef cows, a mixture of Aberdeen Angus, Charolais and Hereford, all beef cows. He also takes in around 200 sheep from a farm in the Highlands for winter grazing.
